intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. coloratulum, commonly known as the purple meadowhawk, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with purple markings, and it produces small, elongated seeds in a fluffy pappus. It is often found in open habitats and is considered a minor component of the flora in its native regions.
